title: Mictlanpachecatl
text: In <a href="Aztec%20mythology">Aztec mythology</a>, Mictlanpachecatl (pronounced: mikt-*lawn-pah-che-kot) is the god of the <a href="North%20wind">North wind</a>. His brothers are <a href="Cihuatecayotl">Cihuatecayotl</a>, <a href="Tlalocayotl">Tlalocayotl</a>, and <a href="Huitztlampaehecatl">Huitztlampaehecatl</a>, who personify the winds from the <a href="West%20wind">west</a>, <a href="East%20wind">east</a>, and <a href="South%20wind">south</a> respectively.
